etymologies: Middle English: from Old French plaiz, from late Latin platessa, from Greek platus ‘broad’

definitions: a North Atlantic flatfish which is a commercially important food fish.

notes.text: Two species in the family Pleuronectidae: the European Pleuronectes platessa, often found in very shallow water, and the American Hippoglossoides platessoides, found in deeper waters

shortDefinitions: North Atlantic flatfish which is commercially important food fish
